DOC.brief_summary: The purpose clinical research study determine whether dapagliflozin improve ( decrease ) blood glucose value patient Type 2 diabetes moderate renal impairment.This study conduct approximately 100 centre country across North America European region . It plan randomize total 302 patient .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Evaluate Effect Dapagliflozin Blood Glucose Level Renal Safety Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
DOC.criteria: Female male age ≥18 year < 75 year . History T2DM 12 month . Inadequate glycemic control , define HbA1c ≥7.0 % ≤11 % Stable antidiabetic treatment regimen Renal impairment : CKD 3A Women childbearing potential unwilling unable use acceptable method avoid pregnancy entire study period . History diabetic ketoacidosis hyperosmolar nonketotic coma . Severe uncontrolled hypertension define SBP ≥180 mmHg and/or Diastolic Blood Pressure ( DBP ) ≥110 mmHg Any follow Cardiovascular ( CV ) /Vascular Diseases within 3 month prior sign consent visit 1 : Myocardial infarction , Cardiac surgery revascularization ( CABG/PTCA ) , Unstable angina , Unstable heart failure ( HF ) , HF New York Heart Association ( NYHA ) Class IV , Transient ischemic attack ( TIA ) significant cerebrovascular disease , Unstable previously undiagnosed arrhythmia . History biopsy image verify intercurrent kidney disease ( glomerular nephritis sign renal artery stenosis ) diabetic nephropathy diabetic nephropathy nephrosclerosis . Significant hepatic disease , include , limited , chronic active hepatitis and/or severe hepatic insufficiency . Ongoing treatment SGLT2inhibitor , GLP1 analogue , rapid/short act insulin screen . Participation another clinical study Investigational Product ( IP ) last 30 day prior sign consent visit 1 .
